text: I loved the views that our apartment had, and the breakfast waiters were all very friendly and helpful, but the cleanliness of the facilities was not correct, the check out at 10:00 was too early, and the beds were not very comfortable.I give a 10 to the views and location of the hotel.

It was our first trip to Madeira and thanks to Saccharum we have already started to miss it. The hotel is situated in a peaceful hamlet of Cahleta boasting with a private beach . The beach is a bit gray and stony but still safe to bathe thanks to the breakwaters . The lifeguard was very keen to save our lives but we gave him no chance. After a swim you can refresh yourself at the beach bar where  a poncha drink and a tasty nibble is available .The hotel room was very spacious and clean and all the bathroom facilities were of high standard. There was also a fridge, safe and a stove so if you were not happy with hotel meals you could cook something by yourself. We had a room in the furthest building on the 7th floor with very good sea view and far away from hotel noise. As an advantage two floors above us there was an indoor swimming pool which we used frequently. From the ninth floor terrace one could take a small stroll to the main sun bathing complex with outdoor swimming pool with a beautiful view of Atlantic Ocean and Cahleta marina.The pool bar served variety of good quality food.The main restaurants were situated on the second floor in the main building. One could have a meal on the nice terrace and enjoy  excellent views including Madeira sunset. So there was something good for your body and soul.The hotel staff was amazing; very polite and helpful- ready to sort out any problem you had.It is a pity that our stay was so short but we hope to be back in the future.

Good location and ideal conditions for resting and taking good walks.The friendliness and professionalism of the staff who work at the hotel, as well as the proximity to the sea make the stay a pleasant one.

I just stayed last night at this wonderful place,The rooms were large and gorgeous (I was in room 105), the staff was pleasant and helpful beyond belief and my breakfast was superb. My intuition is when they develop a larger reputation and following they will switch to buffet style; as it is currently the breakfast is ordered but the choices are extensive and there is no hesitation in giving more food, even urging food on you.Because of the building style, like a 15th century monastery the corridors are wide and long and not particularly well heated but the enclosed rooms, restaurant, bar, etc are quite comfortable.It is elegant placed in the center of the old Braga.There are only a couple of nits that could be fixed for it to be as close to perfect as ny commercial hotel can be.To be ecologically aware, they don't have a book about the hotel in the room with telephone numbers, etc and the phone has no markings. All this information is potentially available on the television. However my television had Cyrillic text and it took a technician to correct that and he could never find the hotel information with internal telephone numbers for room service or reception. The one time I did need something, I had to dress and walk down to the reception to get any response (which was quick.).The second issue was that I was parked in the secured back parking lot, inside a gate that was opened when I called the front desk on arrival.When I was leaving, there was no obvious way to open the gate on my own, no button on a stalk I could reach from my car, no pressure pad under the driveway and I had to call the front desk again. It was raining very, very hard and I wasn't about to get out and look around.The third and last was that, the room electricity is controlled by putting one's key  in a slot inside the door.So, when I was leaving the lights went out immediately and I had to fumble around in the total dark for both my suitcase and the door handle. (The corridor door is in an anteroom and there is no ambient light coming from windows.) Surely there could be a 10 second delay before the lights go out.All that being said, this is a wonderful place that I would recommend to anyone for the general quality, the decor, the excellence of staff and food and the location.

The location of the hotel is literally fantastic, the views towards the cliff are spectacular, being able to have breakfast or dinner with these views is wonderful, all the hotel staff have been super attentive and friendly during our stay, it is a totally recommendable hotel, we will return for sure , the breakfast is magnificent and the lunches-dinners too. A note, if when making the reservation you do not have the option to choose a room with cliff views available, you will have views towards the hotel entrance, which are not particularly beautiful.

This was a very nice hotel in a great location.  The indoor pool was great and nice size.  There were a number of outdoor pools spread around the property.  The beach is in walking distance and it is beautiful.  We had 3 rooms and a full kitchen.  Both the restaurants on the beach were very good.  The town was beautiful and there were great reataurants and shopping and they offer tours of the caves which was awesome.

We have just returned from 10 fantastic days in Jupiter Family Fun. From the youngest to the oldest,  we throughly enjoyed every minute.  The staff are amazing through out the hotel. Looking forward to next year...

Took my boyfriend for his birthday and it really did go above my expectations. Food nice, Staff nice, Location great ! Only downfall is it is over 2 hours away from the airport but the  hotel made up for that, I would add photos but my phone is currently broken.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Wonderful hotel with comfortable beds in the most lovely neighborhood. I loved the view from the windows to that scenic wide boulevard. The restaurant was excellent and the staff super nice. The in room coffee maker was broken however and after I complained it was still not working.

Nicely designed hostel - period features as well as being to modern - would appeal to young people as  it has a communial area to meet people, play table tennis etc. Also liked the help yourself fridge where you pay by putting money in an honesty box. Staff where very accommodating.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: William was a perfect host while at the bar.  He was friendly and chatty.   The restaurant in the hotel was amazing and very romantic.  The wine list was fabulous and the food outstanding. The outdoor garden area was beautiful.  We enjoyed our 5 nights and will be returning again.  Thank all the staff for their attentiveness.

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: Was lucky enough to experience this resort for my milestone birthday and I wanted to stay longer. This resort has it for everyone. It‚Äôs a big resort with different styles of accommodations. They have I think 11 restaurants to choose from. Never have I been disappointed with the food or service. The beach is easy access and you can walk for miles and miles. The service is top notch. The little town of Albufeira is 10 min by taxi for approx 15 euros. Thank you team Pine Cliffs. We will be back. So relaxing. Obrigada!!!

Quinta do Mel is an extraordinary place for ultimate relaxation. The owners and people in the restaurant were very friendly and helpful. Even on our last day we were able to keep our room till the evening- not having to worry about check out time.Every other day we had dinner here, superfresh fish or perfectly cooked meat with some lovely wines and for a good price. A couple of times we had some sangria; both the white and the red sangria were the best I ever had! Enjoying it outsideThe tea (made using the herbs from the garden- I recommend the rosemary tea :)) and cookies that they provide daily in your room in the evening (on the house) was a nice extra to look forward to.The beach Falesia was about a 20min walk away - past orange and olive trees near the hotel- and was very nice, and the beach was very empty (mid May) which was a pleasant surprise.If youre planning to go to the Algarve, this is a good option if youre not looking to get away from the buzz of the city and away from mass tourism.

Have recently returned from a 4 night break at the Forte do Vale hotel . When we arrived we were infomed that we would be staying in a members suite (very nice). The staff were all very helpfull and polite and the room spotless.We were on a BB basis and the first morning the breakfast was excellant as it was cooked fresh due to so few guests.But as the wk end approached it became buffet style and the food was luke warm and only fair.Another tip take your own pool towel as the charge is 10 euros per towel which with only a couple of days use i thought expensive Also the tourist train stops just across the road (very handy).Overall i would recommend to a friend.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Use this hotel every year as our base for our golf trip to the area and they never fail to exceed expectations.Rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean everyday and a well stocked and reasonably priced mini bar.Breakfast is superb with a great choice of healthy options and also full cooked breakfasts including made to order omelettes (highly recommended)Bar is great with fabulous staff and look forward to seeing them next year

I've been lucky enough to be able to say I've travelled to many places in the world with the likes of London, New York and Barcelona to name a few and I can honestly say that Lisbon Desitnation Hotel is the best place I've stayed in. Right in the centre of what's happening in Lisbon the staff are friendly and welcoming and the rooms and hostel itself are modern and stylish. I couldn't recommend this place high enough.

Good hotel with an excellent room that even had a balcony to sit outside. Breakfast was generally good but had a queue to get coffee- there are only 2 machine and one was out of action both days. There is a charge to use the swimming pool (15 euro) which is a disgrace and you need a swim hat as well. Can do better!

We recently stayed at this hotel on a family holiday.Location is fantastic. It is around 5-10 mins to the beach. And is exactly half-way between the old town and the 'strip' with about a 15-20 walk to each (downhill walk to old town, uphill walk to strip).The hotel itself is very clean. Our room was a 1 bedroom apartment on the fourth floor. Pool view and you could see the sea as well. Rooms were very big with a bedroom, bathroom (bath & shower), kitchen, and living room/dining room. Kitchen was well equipped with cooker, hob, fridge, microwave & toaster. As other reviews have said, no electric kettle so you have to use the hob. One of the sockets in our kitchen didn't work so we had to move the toaster to the living room and couldn't use the microwave. This was too much of a big deal for us, but could have posed a problem for others.Huge balcony saw the sun for most of the day but the rooms still didn't get too hot. There is air-conditioning if you need it.Other reviews have criticised the pool bar for removing towels but we didn't experience this at all, perhaps it was because it was quieter when we were there. The guy who served us at the pool bar was pleasant and the food was pretty good.Both swimming pools (main pool and kids pool) were cold but were ok once you got in. Previous guests had left inflatable toys and rubber rings which our daughter loved. Showers at the pool weren't great.There was a few bars right next door to the hotel but most nights we would head to the beautiful old town. You can walk (downhill) in around 20 mins but it is a bit of a trek on the way home as its quite a steep hill. There is a tourist train that will bring you to/from the old town although it can take about 35/40 mins at night.Overall, a great location. Would suit couples, young families (due to lack of entertainment in the evening for older kids), and friends (willing to walk to the strip).

Absolutely recommendable. Be it only to stay a few nights when on the journey through or for 1-2 week surf course, this is the place to go! The staff is friendly, competent and definitely fun to be around.

We checked in at 11pm and after a nightcap returned to our room.  I was astonished to find the bed extremely lumpy on further inspection I found the mattress protector was flat in some parts and very lumpy (scrunched up) in others making for a strange looking bed!.  It looked like it had been washed at the wrong temperature?  I immediately rang reception and she asked me straight away if the problem was the topper. I was surprised that she was not shocked at my call.   She offered to let us move rooms but this was the last thing we wanted to do at 12.30 am.  I didn't want to cause a fuss and suggested that they just change the topper.   Over 45 minutes passed and my partner rang reception and asked why there was a delay.  Eventually a member of staff arrived with a full armoury of bedding (quilt/pillows/sheets/ pillow cases/quilst cover/vallance/topper and proceeded to mutter and moan, huff and puff her way through making the whole bed! I offered to help her (not a wise move) and also tried to explain we only wanted the topper changed!  She tutted and shook her hands at me, so we stood there like naughty children (I'm 40) and let her get on with it.  After another 15 minutes, she finally left.  After a long day of travelling we finally got to sleep at 2.30am.   We were only on holiday for 2 days so I wasn't very impressed to say the least.  The following day, I asked to speak with the Duty Manager, Nelson.  He was very apologetic and assured me that he would look into the matter and \look after us\".   We heard nothing from Nelson.  The next day (our last) as we were checking out I asked to speak with him again as nothing had been done to compensate our unnecessary uncomfortable first night.  I waited at reception for nearly 1 hour
month: finally he arrived and said he had not had time to speak with his staff regarding the matter yet (26 hours later) and that he had not said anything about compensating our time.  He then informed me that he had sent something up to the room (two small bottles of Port which none of us drink and 4 custard cakes from breakfast) I later returned the wine and threw the cakes away.  I asked him why he had not looked into the matter earlier
year: he replied that he was thorough and like to hear both sides of the story!  I was insulted that he was suggesting that there was chance I was making this up! I informed him that I thought his treatment of us was both unprofessional and insulting.   This whole episode has left me with a very bad feeling towards the hotel.In general the rooms were clean and acceptable and the staff in the bar area and lobby were very friendly.  The hotel in parts could do with a bit of modernization.  There is a balcony outside the bar in reception which would be a lovely place to sit and have a drink but unfortunately it is full of pigeons and some of the furniture has pigeon droppings on them.  I feel this hotel is better suited to 3 star and not a 4 star establishment.Also a bit of advice on pickpockets.  I consider myself quite an experienced traveller.  The pick pocket problem is Lisbon in huge.  My Mother in Law was unfortunately a victim of this on the No 28 Tram.  Please take care
extracted_date_str: these gangs are very good at what they do.  Keep your bags in front of you and don't press the bell (as I did) when asked
extracted_date: this was their cue to pick her purse (they left it on the floor after they had took her notes out).  I googled it on my return and two of the actual people that were on the Tram are on You Tube
year_int: they have been doing this a while (one video is from 2007) so please be really careful."

text: I had never been in this area before, very good for Bird Watching. The beach is a boat trip of 1/2 an hour away. Also good for Golfers and Bowlers. Quite near the Airport of Faro. The staff were excellent.

Stayed in June a couple of nights for a business conference. The positives are: distance from the airport, nice lobby and bar (watching football on a big screen), room and bathroom were always very clean. Not so good things: dated decor, small pool and no paddling pools for kids, average food (self service lunch) and being really in the middle of nowhere. The hotel has a tiny convenience store, no idea where the nearest larger shop is - nowhere in sight in the close vicinity of the hotel. The petrol station sort of nearby (5-10 mins walk) is where you can get some stuff. On the other hand taxis and uber are very cheap in Lisbon - so it could be a decent base for sightseeing.

If you are looking to have some late morning sleep, then please ask to stay at the back of the hotel.   Yesterday (Saturday) the construction works woke me and continued for the rest of the day.Our suite was fine, though I thought it might be a little bigger.Breakfast was okay, but for the extra that you pay, I expected a little more in term of personal offerings - no eggs or breakfast cooked to order; buffet only.Overall , staff were efficient and friendly.Good location and the ability to walk everywhere.

Stayed here for a week from the 15th may. Newly refurbished and in a great location. Right in the middle of old town and the strip. Rooms are huge and fully equipped for a self catering stay. Only thing missing was an oven. Cleaned daily with new towels. Everything worked as it should.Couple of minor things.....still refurbing so pretty noisey....stay away from level 1. Staff rooms are there for the cleaners and it was super noisey every morning.....you have to leave a deposit for the TV and air con remote.....water goes cold after 2 showers.Things to warn you, pool is freezing....loads of free sunbeds in May.....can't check in until 14.00ish.....they do serve snacks at the bar and breakfast that we wasn't told about.....walk a bit further to the bigger supermarket as it is a lot cheaper......walk to old town and taxi back for 5 euros (cardiac hill), you will see what I mean.....no onsite shop.We had a great time and will be returning at some point. Be warned, hens and stag parties do visit this hotel....normally for 3 days over the weekend but don't let it put you off as they are normally hungover in the day

I like everything about this hotel: friendly and accommodating staffs, location and room. Location is super convenient. It's right at the center of the city center! We always pass by the hotel on our way from one spots to the other, so we got to go back to our room to refresh a little before heading out again. The room itself is clean and spacious with everything you need. I especially like the balcony! There elevator in the building so you don't need to worry about carrying the luggage up. The entrance gate downstairs will be closed after 9pm and you need a code to get in, which makes you feel safe. Will definitely return next time I'm in Lisbon.

Tivoli is a Portuguese chain of resorts. Front desk staff was very welcoming, kind and helpful. Rooms are old and dated, but that is what you should expect anywhere in Europe - it was actually very cute and charming! Room was very clean. We had a breakfast-included room, and breakfast selection was decent. The best part of this hotel is the pool area. The pool sits on top of a small cliff that you can walk down to the beach. It is absolutely stunning. The pool is large and not very busy, and the pool area has a ton of sun chairs. You don't have to wake up at 7 AM to go and claim a chair - it's decently relaxed although it did fill up. There's a lunch restaurant right beside the pool that was very good and offered a good variety of food (salads, burgers, sandwiches, fish, etc). I heard people complaining about the pool being too cold, but I found the cold water perfect as it hits 35-40 degrees there in the summertime. Beach is small but incredibly beautiful, and you have to walk/hike down a few flights of steps to get to it. There wasn't ever anyone on the beach when we were there, which was nice - it was extremely private. They had a shuttle service to Carvoeiro Beach although we didn't use it. There's a small town about 500 metres down the road - a 5 minute walk - with a ton of restaurants and some shops. All in all a beautiful hotel that I can't wait to get back to!

The Moleiro house in the Montemuro mountain has stunning views, excellent amenities and service.A very positive energy.Homemade and comforting breakfast üëåIt is an experience to repeat, it was very refreshing ‚ù£Ô∏èThank you.

Good sized studio room and balcony. Helpful and friendly staff. Good location with a half hour stroll into Funchal but also other restaurants close by. Gorgeous pool area with the added benefit of an indoor pool, spa and gym.
Came from USA to a \Retire in Portugal\" conference (which turned out to be a marketeer's wet dream).  The weekend was mobbed
month: and it seemed as if the city folk from Lisbon
extracted_date_str: mostly for the pool  and the mind-boggling free breakfast they include in the price.  For a sea view
column13: fresh clean sheets!  Nice view (go higher for less noise from the family pool).  Again
column14: that breakfast that was free is off the charts.  (fresh foods
column16: mostly.)  In a quiet part of town
column17: but further to walk to the Centro.Cons:  the \"Free\" wifi is located in the Lobby
column19: no photos download into your emai
column21: no gifs).  We talked to the staff as our advertisement said \"free wifi in room\".  They said
column23: IF YOU APPLY FOR A DISCOVERY CARD.  Whut??  So
column25: no thanks.  So we paid $15/day for wifi in the room
column26: which was as the one in the Lobby
column29: AND only worked 50% of the time.  So don't come here if you are doing business.  Also
column30: the maids cut off the A/C after they clean.  So you come back to a hot box
column32: lol.  Except for our initial nice check lady
column33: the rest of the staff was abrupt and tired and not happy campers.  But the place is a mob scene of families

text: Spent a traumatic week here. Cannot praise Aurelia's and M√°rcio's compassion enough. The hotel's generosity was also beyond reasonable expectation. Special thanks go to the manager for all his work behind the scene.

What a fantastic hotel.  Great location for exploring Lisbon on foot.  Every staff member that I encountered was helpful, friendly, professional, and kind.  I didn't eat in the dining room, but I had delicious food and cocktails in the bar.  The spa has a huge variety of services.  Treat yourself to a massage, it's worth your time.  The shower was the best I've ever encountered.  I'd stay there again for that alone.  Comfortable bed too, and the street is quiet, even though it's close to Avenida Liberdade.  I will not hesitate to stay there again when I'm back in Lisbon.

This hotel was really a great dissapointment. First of all the taxi driver couldn't even find it. Then it appeared - dark, dusty building close to a huge half finished building (which will be another hotel in the nearest future). From the windows you could look into eyes of the builders. We couldn't change the hotel because it has been booked and already paid by our travel agency. Rooms: a disaster - I got one without windows in the bathroom and the smell from the bathroom made me almost faint when I entered the room. Air conditioning was not working at all so I had to keep windows open because of smell and hot. But then constant noise from the streets kept me awake all night. Here I must admit staff turned to be quite helpful, they moved me into another room, this time with windows in the bathroom and air conditioning working. Again I couldn't turn it on because it was too noisy but at least the smell disappeared so I could close the windows. If there is anybody who would like to see the photos I took there which are quite different from what you can find on their www page, I can mail them.

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: The customer service was amazing; we were given beach towels and an umbrella, great recommendations to restaurants and even an iron at 11pm at night so my husband could iron out his wedding suit. Rooms are not large but very comfortable and the breakfast is wonderful. The hotel is within a few minutes walk to the most scenic beaches and a 10 minute walk from the downtown area where the nightlife is more lively.

Spent two nights here while on 10 day holiday over Portugal. This was a relaxing respite from the city stays. Very enjoyable top notch service and beautiful rooms. Breakfast was fantastic but we did. It experience the sky Bar or restaurants

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: The auguries for our short stay were not good: arrival was delayed by two days due to high winds at Funchal Airport. Our decision as to whether to cancel altogether was made by the hotel Manager's kind agreement to roll forward our booking. As soon as we walked through the door we knew our troubles were over.  The warm and courteous reception was echoed  throughout our stay.  The superb service and food at breakfasts were just slightly marred by lukewarm buffet  and we had to call for the services of microwave! Our Classic room was  very well appointed  with wonderful sea views but perhaps a little too much information clutter (could you simplify this?) The gardens are a wonder in themselves.  All this was rounded out with a fine  dinner in Villa Cipriani  - always our favourite. Obrigado !  Ate a  proxima vez.

Second visit to Royal Savoy. The room(suite) was excellent.The standards throughout the Hotel and its Services are first rate with the Staff in all parts of the hotel both obliging and friendly.Its location means you can easily walk into the centre of Funchal in a matter of minutes.

Had a wonderful short break at this hotel. Staff were all friendly and attentive. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice. It did get very busy after 9am, but staff worked hard to make sure this wasn‚Äôt a problem. Pool area clean and spacious with plenty of sun loungers. Ideally located for both the lovely beach and marina. Plenty of good restaurants locally to choose from. The only negative was the treatment in the spa. Unfortunately this probably has to be the worst full body massage I‚Äôve ever received. Perhaps I had been squeezed in and the therapist wasn‚Äôt very happy about it, and this showed throughout the treatment, and the hour treatment was 40/45 mins max. In hindsight, I should have said something at the time. The only reason why I didn‚Äôt give the full 5 stars.

Just had a 5 day break here - my first time and my daughters second time. Lovely large apartment with long balcony - comfortable beds and well equipped kitchen. Reception staff very friendly and the pool area was good with comfy beds. A good location just down a quiet street but still within easy walking distance of local bars and restaurants - we found 2 really good ones:Agapito and Eduardos further up the main road. Both friendly with excellent food! Also enjoyed visiting The Old Town bar with their karaoke nights - really good!

Can't say anything negative about this hotel. Bed is super comfortable. Sea view room was stunning. The bathroom setup is interesting (not). We could see eachother from the toilet to the bed trough a clear curtain. But that was the only thing!Breakfast was amazing with so many choices available and the indoor pool was relaxing at night.A special greeting to the beard man Milton who planned basically all our S√£o Miguel's trip with super joy and laughs.The bar was delightful with tasty cocktails ( thanks Hugo! ) and chill music.Certainly a place to come back!!!

I came to the hotel with my family. We spent 1 week there. I would like to recommend this hotel. The room and terrace are large. Like a small flat. Well-equipped kitchen. big positive for the washing machine and dryer :) very friendly staff. Beautiful swimmimg pool. I would love to come back here again :)

Went for 4 nights  to celebrate  a friend's with 7 other people  was great place. Room was really nice and spacious and balcony was great size in our apartment. Kitchen had everything  washing machine microwave included. Major selling point you are situated close to bars and restaurants but not too close to the major strip  which is fantastic news to be honest.

This was our first stay in this hotel.  We arrived to be greeted warmly at reception and shown our room.  The rooms are spacious with excellent comfortable beds.  We stayed in a junior suite for half of the holiday and this was an excellent upgrade.  Breakfast is first class, anyone that complains about this is being very unreasonable.  There is a quality fruit, meat, cheese selection with excellent additional options of omelette and even British breakfasts for those that cannot leave the UK without having beans, sausage and bacon.  Staff are great around the hotel and the bar is very reasonable for a 5 star when compared to other resorts.  The pool is fantastic with excellent views out to sea.  The pirate ship is excellent for children and you are minutes away from the Marina (bit of a tourist trap).  You will find better and more affordable restaurants away from that area.

Wonderful hotel for families.Fantastic rooms, pools, breakfast and location. Will definitely be back.Short drive from the airport too.Only negative was the lack of entertainment for children in the evenings.Kids club during the day was ideal as parents can still see their kids if laying at the children's pool.

Excellent location, beaches within walking distance. The breakfast is amazing, lots to choose from. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. Staff goes above and beyond to make us feel comfortable and welcoming.We particularly like the gym and spa areas

I am infinity member for 20 years and I could say that the hotel CPO is getting so much better,from the 70 s now it is in the 2020s.Much tidier .palm trees,and lights at night,lights to save climbing steps.easy to reach shops,restaurants,if you prefer to eat out.or eat in if you want.Great staff including Rui ,Lucia and allThey now do an Infiniti member party .free nibbles and drink for free,for 2 hours √∞≈∏¬•∆í√∞≈∏¬•¬µ√∞≈∏¬•¬µ music and a fantastic singer Mauro.

Booked into the hotel as I had been invited to a Christmas party there.  Excellent service from the staff, a really comfortable room and splendid food and wine.  What's not to like.The view over the town was interesting and there was no real traffic noise.  Beds were comfortable and there were a useful table and chairs in the room as well as the balcony.  A kettle is not supplied automatically but the housekeeper produced one with plenty of tea and coffee when asked.The buffet for the party was outstanding - seafood, meats, soup, hot choices and some very nice desserts, including cakes.The breakfast was equally high quality with a wide selection of juices, hot and cold choices of food and delicious breads and rolls.

This was a large 3 star hotel in a great city location. There were several tour groups staying there during our visit. Receptionist had more than they could handle so a few minutes wait. We opted for a city view since we were only there for 1 night. It was loud but traffic not bad after 9pm.  Breakfast was adequate. There was a charge for parking which was understandable but also to use safe which seemed odd. Good place to stay if price is right and for a central location

I highly recommend this hotel not just for romantic couples but also for families. The rooms are huge, more like a suit, and have a little kitchen too. Everyone is super nice and helpful. The hotel has also a restaurant with a nice garden area. It‚Äôs in the heart of Porto so you don‚Äôt need to use public transportation because you can easily explore it by walk. You will love to stay here for sure!

We stayed at this hotel for 15 days in june/july 2018. The room was ok, with a balcony. View to a street facing north. No noiseproblem from traffic. Cleaning was good and so was the breakfast. A lot of sunbeds by the swimmingpool. Just 5-10 minutes walk from the center of Tavira. We hired a parkingspot in the garage, EURO 60 for 15 days.

Very central hotel in Tavira, walking distance from city center and all the restaurants in town, except for \Vela 2\" restaurant.Beach only reachable by boat (line boat) or by car.In July there was a very quiet ambiance
month: very relaxing.Friendly staff.A little too expensive for what you get.Anyway
year: it's  a nice hotel and a secure buy."

text: Nice, clean, larger hotel. We typically prefer small boutique type accommodations. One night is not enough to enjoy it fully. They have activities and a spa, parking garage. There is typically a fee for the parking garage, but since we arrive so late, it was complimentary. 85 Euros included breakfast for us both. The breakfast is buffet style with plenty of choices for all. If it is busy you may have to stand in line for the cook to order pancakes or omelets.

We were so excited when we got to our hotel. It's beautiful and well designed. The staff seemed friendly. They even called our room after we settled in to see how it's going. That was nice. Especially since they claim to be 4 star hotel. When it turned for the worse was when we asked them to arrange a taxi for us. We needed to be picked up at 730am so we can meet for our tour. We booked a $250 tour of Douro Wine Valley. So we go outside to meet our taxi and no taxi. Some man was outside waiting so we thought he must be waiting for a taxi. A few minutes later a male staff member of the hotel came out and asked us if we were waiting for a taxi. We said yes, and he points to the man. Ok, where is the taxi that is marked? Apparently this hotel uses some driver service instead of providing us with a Taxi which we had asked. So we go into an unmarked car. My 6 year old daughter and my wife as well.  We tell him we are going to Lapa Church. He said ok. My wife has Google maps up with love directions and it said 12 minutes. The driver goes in the wrong direction. Then he keeps going and ends up on the freeway during some serious rush hour. My wife is like where the hell is he taking us. Our time keeps going up and we are completely in the wrong direction. We needed to be at our tour 815am. We told the driver Lapa Church, he said yes. We told him he's going in the wrong direction and he says he doesn't speak English. Something clicks and then he starts taking crazy side streets and up and down and bumpy roads. My wife and daughter getting car sick. Which my daughter ended up puking in the backseat. Which my wife caught in my daughter's jacket. We get to our tour late. A 40 minute ride in the wrong direction for a trip that should of taken 12 minutes. We told the tour guy my wife is sick and so is my daughter so we can't make it. After that nonsense, we walk 40 minutes back to our hotel. Get to our hotel and informed who we didn't know at the time was the manager everything that happened and went wrong. Instead of showing any kind of sympathy, all she did was defend the driver and say the roads are busy. Not listening to us as we told her we were using Google maps driving directions live and he went the wrong way. She said it must of been a misunderstanding and he was giving us a tour. What tour? We specifically said we need a ride to the church to catch out tour. So ridiculous. No sympathy, just pointing the finger at us even though they messed up. When someone asks for a taxi, get them a taxi and not some unmarked driver who doesn't use GPS. We confront the staff members who messed up our taxi and asked who the manager was and they said the lady who was unsympathetic. How can that be a manager of a 4 star hotel. The next day, that manager asked to speak to my wife and asked what she can do better if this happens again? Really, you gonna ask us what she should do differently next time. Get some sympathy. Offer some sort of goodwill gesture. We didn't ask for a them to help us get to the train station. We found out Uber was there. Took that, and got to the train station like it said we would. Would I stay there again if we go back to Porto? Not sure, loved the hotel and how comfortable and clean it was. It was the staff and management that made it suck and for us to give it a 1 Star

Beautiful hotel, amazing food, both indoor and outdoor pool! Highly recommend. Walking distance to the beautiful town of Tavira. You have to try the sangria. Very attentive staff and nice sized bedrooms.

Nice ocean view, wonderful indoor  pool, relaxing bar, the staff of the recepttion was very kind. The room was spacious, very relaxing, with unique sofa, and also chair and counter desk was usefu for writing.

Close to the center, yet far enough from  it's confusion.A cosi place with a nice decor. Great service from the staff, very kind and helpful.Got a room with sea view, awesome!The beach is at a small walk distance, this is not any beach, it's one in the great and unique Costa Vicentina.We will be back!

We loved our stay! We spent 2 nights here near the end of a month long trip. This was the perfect place to relax and enjoy the beautiful Douro Valley. I called the hotel once we arrived at the train station and they promptly sent a taxi to pick us up. We had a great view of the Douro and it was wonderful to sit outside and listen to all the birds. The staff couldn't have been more attentive. Every person who worked there always spoke to us and made us feel right at home. We were welcomed upon check-in and someone escorted us to our room. We enjoyed the afternoon wine tasting and had great breakfasts and dinners with wonderful servers. I went for a short hike through the vineyards and enjoyed a massage before we left. This is a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle and enjoy the beauty of the Douro.

I have not heard or listen to such voices singer in a while.  They next time I will come with my family and look for these two people to perform fourThe dancing step the positivity and the energy is something else. I feels relaxed and calmed.  I have enjoyed every bit of it. Thanks guys.

We LOVED this hotel, so clean sophisticated, service was amazing, rooms were perfect. There is a restaurant downstair also very good. Honestly for the price, this was MORE than perfect and much more than what we expected.

I have been positive surprised by this hotel: spacious rooms, although I must admit, that I needed to get used to the place of the shower a bit. Room was very clean.RoomService was excellent, the breakfast room had an awesome view as well as a good selection at the buffet.Restaurant and quality of food and the service was really outstanding as well as the barkeeper who was a bright mind and gave great recommendations.

This place has 2 lovely rooms on the top floor, each with their own bathroom (bathrooms are off the hall). Lots of wood, really clean, very affordable, and a nice breakfast included.  Loved this place. Only slight downside is that the wifi is a bit slow/temperamental. Overall would highly recommend.

This is a great property. Small boutique hotel but excellent in service, in the heart of all the excitement. Had a very enjoyable stay except for a change of room due to unavailability during my stay it was a great experience. The staff lead by Marco, Filipa, Susanna and all others are very friendly and always ready to help. I liked the personalized breakfast served fresh daily to start your day and a glass of port to end your day.

I was with my family and I must say that both the older and the youngest loved being here. For the food, the Service, the pool and everything there is for kids. They even have a pet that shows up at meals!

We had four wonderful nights at this hotel. The team are what make this place extra special, they are friendly, welcoming and go the extra mile. Being on the Gaia side of the city means you get the best views of Porto and are right in the gorgeous River Douro! We were lucky enough to have been upgraded to a room with a view towards the river and access to the club lounge which really made our stay. Concierge & all the reception team  on arrival were outstanding and gave us so much helpful info.We met a manger in the F&B team who was in his first week at the hotel and you would never have been able to tell, his confidence, knowledge, customer service and attentiveness was exceptional as was that of his team at both dinner and breakfast! All our evening meals were simply delicious and Breakfast is fantastic!A visit to the spa is a must with therapeutic spa baths, amazing massage jets in the pool and sensory showers, it was amazing.I travel a lot and have been involved in hospitality for over 20yrs, this hotel is definitely one we will return to. Well done team Hilton Porto Gaia!

A group of us stayed at the Yes! Hostel a couple of weeks ago and were pleasantly surprised.  For the money we paid, we could not grumble but only praise the hostel along with the facilities.  Our room was a 6 man and we ended up sharing with 2 other people, which was fine.  The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy.If you want breakfast make sure you get there early as the hot stuff will be gone quick! The meal that was provided for 10 euros was pretty good; it was a 3 course meal, bargain!The only problem I had was the wifi on floor 2 didn't work which meant we had to go downstairs to use it.  A little inconvenient to be honest!!The location was ideal and overall I would stay here again if I was planning on going to Lisbon.

We stayed for three nights with our 2 teenagers in a suite. We arrived before check -in time, but didn't have to wait as our room was ready for us which was great. Bed arrangement was perfect, we had booked suite with 2 singles and a sofa bed. Sofa bed turned out to be a bit uncomfortable, but staff were excellent and put proper beds in the room for us immediately. Staff were also very helpful with information about sightseeing and getting around.The room was spotless and was cleaned every day. Loved the pool, also very clean. The hotel was a good size, not too big,making it easy to use pool,internet  and drink machine facilities.  Breakfast buffet had a very good selection to choose from, and again staff were very pleasant and helpful, despite being very busy on one of the mornings.We liked the position of the hotel, on a quiet street, near to a metro station. It was a walk of around 15 minutes to the center, ( uphill on the way back ) which was fine by us, but otherwise the metro was a few minutes walk away. We used the metro and train to go to Estoril and we were amazed at how cheap and easy it was to use! There is a small shop nearby which was handy.Checking out was quick and easy as well, we got a wake-up call and a taxi ordered for us as we requested.We would thoughly recommend this hotel as being excellent value for money with very good service and facilities. Particularly if you are travelling with older children, or teenagers.

I really enjoyed my stay in pousada de Viseu. Everything was perfect :First you fill the vibes of this wonderful historical buildingThe room are very clean and confortableFood is amazing and the professionals have been nice and helpful each time I asked for something.

Very large hotel, in its maximum capacity, clearly vocated parq familias without neglecting those who travel alone.Restaurant with little diversity but what there was was well made.The fast meals at the bar...very good (grain burger in rucula bread...delicious.Hotel in need of some \reform\" but at a very good level of cleaning. Spacious rooms that could have more storage points (cabides). Lack of electric chips available...Some simple points that could easily be solved.The spa facilities are very good and they work very well.It makes no sense is that the towels can only be lifted at the receptionIt will definitely be a hotel to which I intend to return in the low season
month: because with fewer people I believe that the service provided will exceed expectations."

text: As strengths of this hotel highlight the magnificent view and the food. The pools are good, although the interior already deserved some improvements on an aesthetic level. The rooms are antique, both in the decor and in the furniture. The main negative point has to do with the lack of sound insulation, you hear everything that happens in the adjacent rooms. The staff are friendly, highlighting those who serve at the restaurant.

Stayed at this hotel whilst travelling through Portugal.Lovely hotel with very spacious checkin and restaurant.The room was a good size and had underground parking (charged extra) which was great for the motorbikes.The pool was lovely but a tad cold.Enjoyed walking into town which was about a 10 min walk.However I would say that Coimbra for me was not very interesting and did not feel is easy and relaxed as other places we stayed during our trip.2 thumbs up for the hotel but nothing for Coimbra!PS. Breakfast was lovely.
